title: Using BMEcat Catalogs as a Lever for Product Master Data on the Semantic Web

author: Alex Stolz, E-Business and Web Science Research Group, Bundeswehr University of Munich

segmentation: My name is Alex Schultz and I worked on his paper together with Martin.
Hepp and Ben are Eagles castoff on the Bundeswehr University Munich.
And the paper that we wrote was indicted using the Aniket catalogs as level for product master data on the Semantic Web.
So what is it about the problem that we are facing is that there is a lack of structured product master data on the web of data and.
There is a second problem and the second problem is that there are web shop owners that have difficulties at maintaining their product data.

Second experiment.

So on average where less than 10 offers provided on Amazon and Google Shopping Germany.
So we search for explanations for this.

An possible explanations could for example be that there is there are marketplace regulations taking effect like they try to limit perhaps the competition among market participants, but that maybe it's a bit speculative, so I think.

That using our approach also the the high quality product master data could contribute to better data quality in the product domain on the semantic web.
